importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the incident and the day of the police report release, indicating when the public was first informed about the crash and the subsequent investigation.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: This is the time the news article was updated, indicating when the latest information about the incident was made available to the public.

keyTakeAways: A car plowed into a children's birthday party tent in Bladensburg, Maryland, resulting in one fatality and 13 injuries.
The driver, a 66-year-old man from Washington, DC, fled the scene initially but later turned himself in.
The deceased was identified as Ashley Hernandez Gutierrez, 31, of Washington.
Multiple children and adults were injured; one child remains in stable hospital condition.
Neighbors reported hearing explosions and saw a car driving erratically before the crash, indicating possible reckless behavior.
The incident prompted emergency response, including ambulances and firefighters, and involved a tent that was torn open and partially collapsed.
The event occurred during a birthday party, highlighting the vulnerability of public spaces and community events to sudden, violent accidents.

namedEntities.name: Ashley Hernandez Gutierrez
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 31-year-old woman who died in the crash.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is the only fatality in the incident and a central figure in the event’s human impact.

namedEntities.name: Jocelyn Route
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A former Prince George’s County school board member and Bladensburg council member.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She provided firsthand eyewitness testimony of the incident, offering critical community perspective on the event.

namedEntities.name: Bladensburg, Maryland

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The driver's residence is tied to the criminal investigation and jurisdictional aspects.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A car drove into a birthday party tent in Bladensburg, Maryland, killing 31-year-old Ashley Hernandez Gutierrez and injuring 13 people, including six adults and eight children. The driver, a 66-year-old man from Washington, DC, initially fled the scene but later turned himself in. Witnesses, including former local council member Jocelyn Route, described the scene with sounds of explosions, screaming, and a car driving erratically. Emergency personnel responded, and victims were transported to hospitals, with one child remaining in stable condition. The incident underscores community safety concerns and the tragic consequences of reckless driving.
title: Driver plows into child’s birthday party in Maryland, killing 1 and injuring 13, turns himself in
